availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Kirkpatrick (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and grand jury foreman)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and grand jury foreman. Jefferson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Maria T. Harris Flournoy Kirkpatrick in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on April 18, 1832. Father of William D. Kirkpatrick, Moses Kirkpatrick, Eliza Janes Kirkpatrick, and Jordina Kirkpatrick. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Household owned an additional four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Foreman of the Caldwell County Grand Jury at the trial of Thomas Wadlington in 1860.
